intro: Gaya gaudichaudiana f. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate gaya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant produces small, elongated fruits that contain a single seed. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
